conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the charged ball to find electric field strength.
The image shows a small ball with mass m and charge q suspended by a string at angle θ.
Identify forces: gravitational force (mg), electric force (qE), and tension (T).
Resolve tension T into vertical (T cos θ) and horizontal (T sin θ) components.
Set up equilibrium conditions: T cos θ = mg and T sin θ = qE.
Solve for tension T: T = mg / cos θ.
Substitute T into horizontal equilibrium equation: (mg / cos θ) sin θ = qE.
Simplify the equation to mg tan θ = qE.
Solve for electric field strength E: E = mg tan θ / q.
